arts.ttl: Jon Brady reveals the Northampton Town instructions that led to Birmingham City shock
arts.sum: A delighted Brady revealed the instructions he gave to his players after bringing on the experienced Martyn Waghorn with 20 minutes to go. A Mitch Pinnock equaliser deep into added time gave the visitors a first ever point at St Andrew’s @Knighthead Park, cancelling out Jay Stansfield’s second half opener.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies deflated with 'poorest goal' admission after Birmingham City draw with Northampton
arts.sum: Chris Davies says Birmingham City’s draw with Northampton ‘feels like a loss’ after the Cobblers snatched a point in stoppage time. If you don’t get the second goal then, in a game like that, it’s 1-0 and you move on.

arts.ttl: Birmingham denied by late Northampton equaliser
Birmingham City away is the toughest challenge - they're the strongest League One side ever - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: Northampton Town manager Jon Brady considers today's trip to Birmingham City to be the hardest test of his side's season. By Brady's own admission, this will be the most difficult afternoon of Northampton's season against expensively assembled Blues, but he expects his players to give it their best shot.

arts.ttl: Six Birmingham City players whose futures are in doubt ahead of January transfer window
arts.sum: Birmingham City have stocked their squad so well that the January transfer window will likely be quiet in terms of incomings – unless players depart that need to be replaced. Sampsted is still adapting to Davies’ way and could become a more important player in the second half of the season, but if he isn’t content with his bit-part then he could seek an exit route in January.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies explains why he will keep postponing Birmingham City matches
arts.sum: Unlike those in the Premier League and Championship, League One clubs don’t automatically have international breaks but they are allowed to postpone a fixture if they receive three call-ups. Chris Davies will continue to postpone games during international windows because he wouldn’t forgive himself if an understrength Birmingham City side dropped points.

arts.ttl: Furious ex-Birmingham City manager grabs and shakes his own player after red card
arts.sum: Former Birmingham City manager Pep Clotet has made headlines in Italy after laying his hands on a player from his own team, who had just been sent off. Furious Clotet witnessed Raimonds Krollis of Triestina - the Serie C side who Clotet now manages - receive his marching orders and confronted him on his way off the pitch.

arts.ttl: Alfie Chang’s next step outlined as Birmingham City midfielder recovers from 14 months out
arts.sum: Blues manager Chris Davies has suggested second string football is the next step for Chang on his road to recovery. Alfie Chang is on track to return to the field before the end of the year after 14 months without pulling on Birmingham City’s colours.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City will be without four players for Northampton Town clash
arts.sum: Blues will still be without wingers Emil Hansson and Scott Wright, while Lee Buchanan is being given time to build up his fitness after more than three months on the sidelines. Buchanan is being put through a mini pre-season having sustained an injury in Blues' penultimate warm up game in July.

arts.ttl: Latest Birmingham City sell-out could lead to chaos after ‘disappointing’ decision
arts.sum: A comment issued to BirminghamLive reads: “Whilst there have been issues with overcrowding at Bordesley Station this season it’s disappointing that West Midlands Rail have sought to address this problem by just removing trains in one direction - this is poor customer service. West Midlands Rail confirmed earlier this week that supporters will no longer be able to travel back to the city centre from Bordesley, which is the closest train station to St Andrew’s.
